frame.name: FR_Deserving
frame.definition:
<def-root>The existence of a <fen>Sufficient_reason</fen> is sufficient reason for an <fen>Eventuality</fen> to happen (this <fen>Eventuality</fen> could be someone taking an action as well as the simple existence of a state of affairs). The agent who is justified in taking the suggested action or in obtaining the state of affairs is not part of the immediate scene, however.
<ex><fex name="Sufficient_reason">The underwater sequences</fex> <t>warrant</t> <fex name="Eventuality">the price of the admission alone</fex>.</ex>
<ex> '<fex name="Sufficient_reason">Desperate situations</fex> <t>call</t> <fex name="Eventuality">for desperate measures</fex> ," said Mr Eames grandly.</ex>
<ex></ex> <asf>Distinctions with other frames</asf>: <ex></ex>
â‰ <frframe>Explaining_the_facts</frframe> This frame differs from Explaining_the_facts in the same way that <frframe>FR_Justifying</frframe> differs from <frframe>FR_Attributing_cause</frframe>: the Sufficient_reason does not actually cause the Eventuality, but it is sufficient to view it as legitimate. <ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : the link to FR_Justifying is made clear in the name of the FEs (State_of_affairs renamed Sufficient_reason). The justification holds not only for actions, but also for states of affairs (hence the renaming of the FE from Action to Eventuality).
</def-root>

FE.name: Sufficient_reason
FE.definition:
<def-root>An Eventuality or an Entity that is taken to constitute sufficient reason for another <fen>Eventuality</fen> to happen.
<ex> <fex name="Sufficient_reason">A heavy contact to the opponent 's face</fex> may not <t>merit</t> just a verbal warning </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Eventuality
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action or state of affairs that is taken to be justifiable given the <fen>Sufficient_reason</fen>.
<ex> The end <t>justifies</t> <fex name="Eventuality">the means</fex>.</ex> <ex> The end <t>justifies</t> <fex name="Eventuality">this situation</fex>.</ex></def-root>
